title: 'Game-changer' drug to tackle addiction
description: Dougie is taking a new drug which blocks his craving for heroin and helps him break the cycle of drugs and crime.

title: Brexit: What has happened since 31 January?
description: There are still major unresolved issues around Brexit and time is running out.

title: Guinea elections: The 82-year-old seeking six more years
description: Guinea's leader Alpha Condé, who spent years in opposition, is seeking a controversial third term.

title: Covid: Family of seven's one-bedroom flat lockdown 'hell'
description: The children's personalities are being changed by the cramped conditions, Sarah Wheddon says.

title: Covid-19: What it's like to live under Tier 2 restrictions
description: Preston, Lancashire, has been categorised as "high risk" under the government's new three-tier system.

title: Coronavirus: Are some soaps better than others?
description: With so many different soaps to choose from, Dr Michelle Wong explains how to find the best soap for you.

title: Down's syndrome language: 'No-one meant anything hurtful"
description: A mother of a young boy with Down's syndrome is helping to teach people about appropriate language.

title: The rape survivors facing an ‘impossible choice’ in Brazil
description: Covid and new rules have made access to legal terminations even more difficult for Brazilian women.

title: 'I know pilots who are driving for Sainsbury's now'
description: Crawley relies heavily on the success of Gatwick. Could the town be facing a long-lasting jobs crisis?

title: Fraud victim: 'I got the shakes every time I went online'
description: As coronavirus adds to online fraud activity and anxiety, one victim tells of his ordeal.

title: I Am Greta: The coming of age movie wrapped up in a super-hero flick
description: A documentary about the teenage climate change activist is compelling because it's so unlikely.

title: US election 2020: Why it matters so much to Germans
description: Trump has singled out Berlin for repeated criticism, but some say it was a much needed wake-up call.

title: Bury: Bringing Football Back
description: The fans bringing football back to the town of Bury

title: Cougar stalk: Utah jogger on six-minute encounter with a mountain lion
description: A jog on his local trail turned into a life-or-death situation for Kyle Burgess in Utah.

title: Breonna Taylor: Boyfriend Kenneth Walker recalls night she was killed
description: Kenneth Walker says he's "a million per cent sure" officers did not identify themselves before entering.

title: Morrisons and Waitrose ditch glitter for Christmas
description: The supermarkets won't use glitter in own-brand crackers and cards as part of sustainability efforts.

title: Soyuz rocket reaches ISS in record time
description: The trip took just three hours and three minutes – half the usual journey time.

title: Wales' only prison football team banned from local league
description: Wales' only prison football team is appealing against being kicked out of a league after 20 years.

title: Is Australia really seeing more shark attacks?
description: Seven people have been killed by sharks this year - the highest number in more than 90 years.

title: Teacher bursary cuts: 'My teaching dreams have been destroyed'
description: The government's scrapped teaching bursaries for the arts and humanities.

title: Covid tier system: What is the tier lockdown system in England?
description: The BBC's Laura Foster uses baked goods to explain how the new Covid alert system in England will work.

title: Coronavirus: What are Northern Ireland's new Covid rules?
description: BBC News NI's Jordan Kenny explains what you need to know about the new Covid-19 restrictions.

title: Highly unlikely Project Big Picture will get traction - Villa chief executive Purslow
description: Project Big Picture plan is "highly unlikely to get traction within the Premier League," says Aston Villa chief executive Christian Purslow.

title: Schools to close in Northern Ireland for two weeks
description: The new restrictions are being announced by the executive in a bid to curb cases of Covid.

title: Coronavirus: Liverpool crowds 'shame our city'
description: Footage shows people dancing in the streets hours before new rules come into effect in Liverpool.

title: HS2 over budget again weeks after work began
description: Ministers admit an extra £800m is needed due to more asbestos discoveries and complexities at London Euston.

title: Herbert Kretzmer: Les Misérables lyricist dies aged 95
description: He penned the hit musical's English lyrics, as well as working on songs like Charles Aznavour's She.

title: Allen retirement a great day for gymnastics - Wilson
description: Olympic bronze medallist Nile Wilson welcomes the announcement by Jane Allen that she will retire from her position as chief executive of British Gymnastics.

title: US election 2020: Will celebrity endorsements help Joe Biden?
description: Taylor Swift, Ariana Grande and Cardi B all support the Democrat. But will US voters follow suit?

title: Karabakh war leaves civilians shell-shocked and bitter
description: As heavy fighting continues in the Armenia-Azerbaijan conflict, the BBC reports from both sides.

title: Covid-19: New three-tier restrictions come into force in England
description: Most of the country is in the lowest tier but millions in the North and the Midlands face extra curbs.

title: New Zealand footballers will not travel to England
description: New Zealand will not travel to Wembley to face England in a friendly next month because of travel and player availability complications.

title: US election: Biden says Florida seniors 'expendable' for Trump
description: The US rivals trade accusations as they visit states that may prove pivotal in next month's election.

title: 'We showed this is a team united' - Southgate & Powell reflect one year on from racism in Bulgaria
description: England boss Gareth Southgate and coach Chris Powell recall the night - one year ago - England stopping their game against Bulgaria due to racist abuse.

title: Coronavirus: Patient has sudden permanent hearing loss
description: UK doctors say it is the first such case they have seen linked to the pandemic coronavirus.

title: Neymar moves second behind Brazil's leading goalscorer Pele
description: Neymar moves second behind Pele in Brazil's all-time leading scorer list by scoring a hat-trick in their 2022 World Cup qualifying win over Peru.

title: Hospital staff held cloth over elderly patient's head
description: Nursing staff ordered security to restrain a 77-year-old man on 19 occasions in order to treat him.

description: Britain's Dina Asher-Smith says she was relieved when the Olympics were postponed because of the uncertainties around training.

title: Meghan avoids 'controversial' topics for fear of putting family 'at risk'
description: The Duchess of Sussex says she sticks to "straight forward" topics to avoid putting her family at risk.
